poem:
### The Droop

In the quiet corner  
of a winter room,  
the rubber plant bows,  
a slow choreography of leaves,  
the fruit of too much kindness.  
  
Yellow pages fall,  
as if the plant is writing  
its solemn history,  
yet still, it dreams,  
one green shoot,  
a whisper of spring  
in the dark soil.
